Yes, here are some tips for handling conflicts when emotions are running high:

1. Take a break: If emotions are running high, suggest taking a break to cool down before continuing the conversation. This will allow everyone to calm down and approach the conflict with a clearer head. 2. Practice active listening: When trying to resolve a conflict, make sure to actively listen to everyone's perspectives. Encourage team members to share their thoughts without interruption or judgement. Active listening can help to deescalate the situation. 3. Use "I" statements: Encourage team members to use "I" statements instead of "you" statements. This can help avoid blame and encourage team members to be more self-reflective. 4. Find common ground: Look for areas of agreement and common ground. This can help build a foundation for working towards a resolution. 5. Be respectful: Encourage team members to be respectful at all times, even if they don't agree with each other. Disrespectful behavior can quickly escalate the situation. 6. Use a mediator: Consider bringing in a third party mediator if the conflict cannot be resolved within the team. A mediator can help facilitate communication and find a resolution that works for everyone. It's important to remain calm when dealing with conflicts, and to encourage team members to do the same. Being respectful and practicing active listening are key to finding a resolution when emotions are running high.
